intro: Caperonia acalyphifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved caper, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
